intro: Acer lungshengense, commonly known as the Lungsheng maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils in temperate climates. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. The bark is smooth and greyish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
